welcome_message_body: "Welcome to Calumpang, Philippines! Known for its charming beauty and rich culture, we invite you to explore our city and enjoy all it has to offer."

terminals.name: Terminal 1
terminals.description: The oldest and largest terminal at Ninoy Aquino International Airport, serving both domestic and international flights.

terminals.name: Terminal 2
terminals.description: Also known as the Centennial Terminal, it primarily serves Philippine Airlines and its subsidiaries for both domestic and international flights.

terminals.name: Terminal 3
terminals.description: The newest and largest terminal at Ninoy Aquino International Airport, serving both domestic and international flights for various airlines.

terminals.name: Terminal 4
terminals.description: Also known as the Domestic Terminal, it is the smallest terminal at Ninoy Aquino International Airport, serving mostly domestic flights.

wifi.note: Free WiFi is available throughout the airport, but it may be slow and unreliable at times.

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: This terminal serves domestic flights to and from Baler and other nearby cities.

terminals.name: International Terminal
terminals.description: This terminal serves international flights to and from Baler, connecting to major cities around the world.

wifi.note: Free WiFi is available throughout the airport.
